Frank,Do you personally make boxes for purchase?
Teddy

--- On Mon, 8/30/10=
, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <=
purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] How do you tell?
To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, August 30, 2010, 1:56 AM















 =

=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      =C2=A0Well, "the box" in nothing m=
ore than a radio with swept tuning--as far as I know and have experienced, =
sweep across the radios tuning range, or band generates bits of speech musi=
c and noise that=C2=A0the entities use to reform into their voices, althoug=
h there maybe more involved, but I don't know how one would test it.=C2=A0=
=C2=A0

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Most of the boxes for sale out there are the hack radi=
o boxes. Many of the modern digital radios have a function that mutes, or q=
uiets the radio while tuning between stations. I'm not sure why, but unmutt=
ing the radio allows the audio to be heard while the radio searches for the=
 next station--and--the radio is disallowed form locking onto a station,=C2=
=A0so it keeps sweeping all the way to the end of the band--AM or FM, then =
starts over. This creates the raw audio and "they" speak. The sweep can eve=
n be done by hand, tuning a radio slowing by hand. I sue cheap radios I get=
 at thrift stores for this, gluing a dowel to the tuning knob to make it ea=
sier. Then record form the speaker--open air. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0So as long as =
the radio sweeps at not to fast and not too slow, it'll works. Some are bet=
ter than others. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0It takes some practice, and maybe even a cer=
tain allowing to hear the ghost voices. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0I prefer to take a tu=
ner out of a radio, such as a clock radio and supply an external sweep volt=
age. The sweep circuits are just basic op amps, and you can buy a function =
generator kit to supply a triangle wave for linear sweep. See keyportparano=
rmal.com for more info on using this kit, and building boxes. 

=C2=A0
=C2=
=A0One problem with this stuff is that it can be extremely subjective, othe=
rs may not hear what you hear, or hear it the same. I think mostly the mess=
ages are meant for the one that receives it. We go round and round with the=
 skeptics and debunkers.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S

On Sun, Aug 29, 2010 at 11:08 P=
M, usmcmacswife <usmcmacswife@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



Ok, we're new =
here hello!

We just had a couple questions. HOW do you tell if you're bein=
g ripped off if you are searching online to buy a box? If you can point us =
in the right direction of where to purchase a "frank's box" would be deeply=
 appreciated.

We saw that you can try and make your own but with my husban=
d's work schedule and mine with 4 kids, sports etc.. the only time we get t=
o work with EVP's and such is when we schedule an investigation and secure =
a babysitter! LOL Not to mention my husband isn't that technologically incl=
ined. That is my job... and I would be afraid that I'd have done something =
incorrectly and what we were experiencing really wasn't "true".

Sorry to s=
ound like such a newbie I'm sure!

Thank you! Teddy






    
     

    
=

      <p></p><div> Well, "t=
he box" in nothing more than a radio with swept tuning--as far as I know an=
d have experienced, sweep across the radios tuning range, or band generates=
 bits of speech music and noise that the entities use to reform into t=
heir voices, although there maybe more involved, but I don't know how one w=
ould test it.  </div>

<div> </div>
<div> Most of the b=
oxes for sale out there are the hack radio boxes. Many of the modern digita=
l radios have a function that mutes, or quiets the radio while tuning betwe=
en stations. I'm not sure why, but unmutting the radio allows the audio to =
be heard while the radio searches for the next station--and--the radio is d=
isallowed form locking onto a station, so it keeps sweeping all the wa=
y to the end of the band--AM or FM, then starts over. This creates the raw =
audio and "they" speak. The sweep can even be done by hand, tuning a radio =
slowing by hand. I sue cheap radios I get at thrift stores for this, gluing=
 a dowel to the tuning knob to make it easier. Then record form the speaker=
--open air. </div>

<div> </div>
<div> So as long as the radio sw=
eeps at not to fast and not too slow, it'll works. Some are better than oth=
ers. </div>
<div> </div>
<div> It takes some practice, and maybe =
even a certain allowing to hear the ghost voices. </div>
<div> </div>
=
<div> I prefer to take a tuner out of a radio, such as a clock radio a=
nd supply an external sweep voltage. The sweep circuits are just basic op a=
mps, and you can buy a function generator kit to supply a triangle wave for=
 linear sweep. See <a rel=3D"nofollow" target=3D"_blank" href=3D"http://key=
portparanormal.com">keyportparanormal.com</a> for more info on using this k=
it, and building boxes. </div>

<div> </div>
<div> One problem wi=
th this stuff is that it can be extremely subjective, others may not hear w=
hat you hear, or hear it the same. I think mostly the messages are meant fo=
r the one that receives it. We go round and round with the skeptics and deb=
unkers.</div>
